Taliaferro County is a county in the U.S. state of Georgia. As of the 2010 census, 1,717 people lived there. The county seat is Crawfordville.

[[Gopurangal Saivathillai]]

CATEGORIES: 1982 movies, Indian movies

Gopurangal Saivathillai is a 1982 Tamil language drama film written and directed by Manivannan. The film features Mohan, Suhasini and Radha in lead roles, while S. Ve. Shekher and Vinu Chakravarthy play supporting roles. The film had musical score by Ilaiyaraaja and was released on 15 October 1982. This was Manivannan's first film as director. It was remade in Telugu as Mukku Pudaka with Bhanu Chander, Suhasini and Vijayashanti, while Suhasini reprising her role from the original. It was remade in Kannada as Brahma Gantu (1985),and in Hindi as Naseeb Apna Apna (1986).

[[Bob Northern]]

CATEGORIES: 1934 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from respiratory failure, American jazz musicians, American educators, Musicians from North Carolina, Musicians from New York City, Musicians from Washington, D.C.

Robert Northern (May 21, 1934 – May 31, 2020), known professionally as Brother Ah, was an American jazz French hornist. He was born in North Carolina and raised in New York City. 

In the 1970s he released several albums as a bandleader; his 1974 release Sound Awareness featured Max Roach and M'Boom. He taught at Dartmouth College from 1970 to 1973, Brown University from 1973 to 1982 and then at the Levine School of Music in Washington, D.C. from 1982.

Northern was also the founder of the World Music Ensemble. 

Northern died in Washington D.C. on May 31, 2020 of respiratory failure aged 86.

[[National Assembly (Slovenia)]]

CATEGORIES: Slovenia

The National Assembly (Državni zbor Republike Slovenije, dəɾˈʒàːwni ˈzbɔ́ɾ ɾɛˈpúːblikɛ slɔˈʋèːnijɛ or -ˈzbɔ̀ːɾ-; Slovene abbreviation DZ), is the general representative body of Slovenia. In the Constitution of Slovenia and the Constitutional Court of Slovenia, it is the major part of the bicameral Slovenian Parliament, the legislative branch of the Republic of Slovenia. 

It has 90 members, elected for a four-year term. 

[[Chantal Monaghan]]

Chantal Monaghan (born August 11, 1996) is an Australian model born in Sydney. She has worked for L’Oreal, Ralph Lauren, Jo Mercer, Giorgio Armani, Tom Ford, Vogue Netherlands, Jean-Paul Gaultier, and Maybelline. She has walked in Paris haute couture and in New York, London, and Milan ready-to-wear shows for Armani, Emporio Armani, Jean Paul Gaultier, Zuhair Murad, and Chanel.

[[Vice President of Peru]]

CATEGORIES: Vice Presidents of Peru

The Republic of Peru has two Vice Presidents who are elected along with the President in democratic elections. Their only mission is to replace the President in case of death, resignation or removal from office.

The Vice Presidents are first in the Presidential line of succession.

Historically, the job only had one Vice President, which was in place between 1829–1831 and 1858–1862. The two Vice Presidential positions of First and Second Vice Presidents have been in place since 1862.

[[David Waisman]]

CATEGORIES: 1937 births, Vice Presidents of Peru, Living people

David Waisman Rjavinsthi (born 4 May 1937) is a Peruvian politician. He is a member of Perú Posible since 1994, and was elected as a Congressman in 2000, 2001, and 2006, representing Lima. 

[[Luis Giampietri]]

CATEGORIES: 1940 births, Vice Presidents of Peru, Living people

Luis Alejandro Giampietri Rojas (born 31 December 1940) is a retired admiral of the Peruvian Navy and a politician. He is a member of the  Peruvian Aprista Party.  Giampietri ran successfully as Alan García's first running mate in the 2006 Peruvian election, and was sworn in on 28 July 2006 and served until 28 July 2011. He was also elected as Congressman representing the Constitutional Province of Callao for the 2006-2011 term. He lost his seat in the 2011 elections when he ran for re-election under the Radical Change party, but he received a minority of votes and the Radical Change failed to pass the electoral threshold and subsequently lost it's registration the following year. Before he served as Vice President and Congressman, Giampietri was a Lima City Councilman from 1999 to 2002, elected under the Fujimorist Vamos Vecino, close to-then President Alberto Fujimori.

Giampietri was one of the naval officers implicated in the massacre on El Frontón, a prison island off the coast of Callao. The massacre took place during Alan García's administration, on June 18, 1986, after Shining Path prisoners staged an uprising at El Frontón and two other prisons. All the prisoners involved in the rebellion were killed, and Human Rights Watch claimed that evidence suggested that "no fewer than ninety" of the prisoners killed were victims of extrajudicial executions.

[[Javier Alva Orlandini]]

CATEGORIES: 1927 births, 2020 deaths, Vice Presidents of Peru

Javier Alva Orlandini (December 11, 1927 – June 1, 2020) was Peruvian politician and lawyer. He was a member of the political party Popular Action. He was the 2nd Vice President of Peru during the government of Fernando Belaúnde from 1980 to 1985.He later served as President of Peru's Constitutional Tribunal from 2002 to 2005. 

He wrote several books, including "Responding to the Dictatorship", "Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow", the "Vicious Circle", "I Minister", "Word of Honor" and "Yes I swear", and numerous legal articles. The audits, representative legislative, legal, academic and professional are of extensive quality and are recognized by the Peruvian people and their various institutions that have given many honorary degrees.

He was the 2nd Vice President of Peru during the government of Fernando Belaúnde from 1980 to 1985. 

Throughout his life he became a Deputy from 1963 to 1968, Minister of Government and Police from 1965 to 1966, Senator from 1980 to 1985 and from 1990 to 1992, President of the Senate from 1981 to 1982, and Congressman from 1995 to 2000.

He ran for President in 1985, but got 4% of the popular vote, losing to Alan García.

[[Congress of the Republic of Peru]]

CATEGORIES: Peru

The Congress of the Republic of Peru (Congreso de la República) is the unicameral body that is legislative power in Peru. 

The current Congress of Peru, sworn in after the 2020 elections, was elected after the dissolution of the previous Congress by President Martin Vizcarra. 

Congressmen serve for a five-year term and can be re-elected as many times as they want even though this is very rare. Elections for congress happen at the same time as the election for president. 

In 2020, Mirtha Vásquez was elected President of the Congress.

[[The Bridges of Madison County (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1995 movies, American romantic drama movies, Movies based on books

The Bridges of Madison County is a 1995 American romantic drama movie based on the best-selling novel of the same name by Robert James Waller. 

It was produced by Amblin Entertainment and Malpaso Productions, and distributed by Warner Bros. Entertainment. 

The movie was produced and directed by Clint Eastwood with Kathleen Kennedy as co-producer. 

The movie is about an Italian war bride, Francesca Johnson (Meryl Streep), who lives with her husband and two children on their Iowa farm. In 1965, she meets National Geographic photojournalist, Robert Kinkaid (Eastwood).

The movie earned $182 million worldwide. Streep received an Academy Award for Best Actress nomination in 1996 for her performance in the movie.

[[Thembelihle Mkize]]

CATEGORIES: 1995 births, Living people, South African water polo players

Thembelihle Mkize (born 24 November 1995) is a South African water polo player.

She competed for the South Africa women's national water polo team in the 2013 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Lennie Niehaus]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2020 deaths, Cardiovascular disease deaths in California, American saxophonists, American composers, Musicians from St. Louis, Missouri

Leonard Niehaus (June 11, 1929 – May 28, 2020) was an American saxophonist, arranger, and composer. He played with the Stan Kenton big band, Ray Vasquez Trombonist and Vocalist, Phil Carreon Orchestra, and other jazz bands. He was a movie score composer and worked many times with Clint Eastwood.

Niehaus died on May 28, 2020 under hospice care in Redlands, California from heart disease at the age of 90.

[[Lee-Anne Keet]]

CATEGORIES: 1982 births, Living people, South African water polo players

Lee-Anne Keet (born 12 October 1982) is a South African water polo player. She competed for the South Africa women's national water polo team in the 2009 World Aquatics Championships, and 2013 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Ingvar Ericsson (runner)]]

CATEGORIES: 1927 births, 2020 deaths, Swedish Olympians

Ingvar Axel Harald Ericsson (31 August 1927 – 14 May 2020) was a Swedish middle-distance runner. He was in the 1500 m event. He competed at the 1952 and 1956 Summer Olympics and finished eighth in 1952. 

At the European championships he was seventh in 1950 and fourth in 1954. Ericsson won the national 1500 m title in 1952, 1954 and 1955. He was a firefighter by profession.

[[Asif Farrukhi]]

CATEGORIES: 1959 births, 2020 deaths, Editors, Translators, Pakistani writers

Asif Aslam Farrukhi (آصف اسلم فرخی), was a Pakistani writer and editor. He was a physician by training. He translated books from English into Urdu. He edited anthologies of Pakistani writers. He also wrote for Dawn and other newspapers, and periodicals on literature. He received the Tamgha-e-Imtiaz, the fourth highest civilian honour of Pakistan.

Farrukhi was born on 16 September 1959. He died on 1 June 2020 in Karachi, aged 60.

[[Joey Image]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 births, 2020 deaths, American rock drummers, Deaths from liver cancer, Cancer deaths in Florida, Musicians from New Jersey

Joey Image (born Joey Poole; 5 March 1957 – 1 June 2020) was an American punk rock drummer. He joined the Misfits in November 1978. He was the drummer for both the "Horror Business" and "Night of the Living Dead" in 1979. He was born in Weehawken, New Jersey.

In 2016, he was diagnosed with liver cancer. Image died on 1 June 2020 in Florida from the disease, aged 63.

[[Tarryn Schooling]]

CATEGORIES: 1991 births, Living people, South African water polo players

Tarryn Schooling (born 18 January 1991) is a South African water polo player. She competed for the South Africa women's national water polo team in the 2013 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Lee Grosscup]]

CATEGORIES: 1936 births, 2020 deaths, Accidental deaths from falls in the United States, New York Giants players, Sportspeople from California, People from Santa Monica, California

Clyde Lee Edward Grosscup (December 27, 1936 – June 1, 2020) was an American football player and broadcaster. He was born in Santa Monica, California. Grosscup played for the New York Giants from 1959 to 1961. He spent one season calling AFL games for NBC. He retired in 2018.

Grosscup died on June 1, 2020 from problems caused by a fall in Utah, aged 83.

[[Janez Kocijančič]]

CATEGORIES: 1941 births, 2020 deaths, Lawyers, Slovenian politicians

Janez Kocijančič (October 20, 1941 – June 1, 2020) was a Slovene politician and lawyer. He was also the President of the Slovenian Olympic Committee from 1991 to 2014. From 1993 to 1996, he was Deputy.

Kocijančič died on June 1, 2020 in Ljubljana, aged 78.

[[Kimberly Schmidt]]

CATEGORIES: 1983 births, Living people, South African water polo players

Kimberly Schmidt (born 22 September 1983) is a South African water polo player. She competed for the South Africa women's national water polo team in the 2013 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Anke Jacobs]]

CATEGORIES: 1987 births, Living people, South African water polo players

Anke Jacobs (born 28 July 1987) is a South African water polo player. She competed for the South Africa women's national water polo team in the 2013 World Aquatics Championships and 2014 FINA Women's Water Polo World Cup.

[[Myroslav Skoryk]]

CATEGORIES: 1938 births, 2020 deaths, Ukrainian writers, Composers, Ukrainian educators

Myroslav Skoryk (Мирослав Михайлович Скорик, 13 July 1938 – 1 June 2020) was a Ukrainian composer and teacher. His music is contemporary. He was born in Lwów, Ukraine. 

Skoryk was awarded the titles People's Artist of Ukraine and Hero of Ukraine. In April 2011 Skoryk was made artistic director of Kyiv Opera, a position he held until 2016. He also taught at the Lviv and Kyiv conservatory.

Skoryk died on 1 June 2020 in Kyiv, Ukraine at the age of 81.

[[Maurice Dayan]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2020 deaths, French educators, Scientists from Paris

Maurice Dayan (25 January 1935 – 2 May 2020) was a French psychoanalyst and university professor. He taught psychology at the University of Montpellier, then at Paris Descartes University. Dayan then was a professor of psychopathology at Université Sorbonne Paris Nord, then at Paris Diderot University. 

From 1995 to 2000, he directed the Laboratoire de psychanalyse et de psychopathologie, which was created by Laplanche in 1970.

Dayan died on 2 May 2020 at the age of 85.

[[Aldir Blanc]]

CATEGORIES: Brazilian musicians, Brazilian writers, Composers, People from Rio de Janeiro, 1946 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Brazil

Aldir Blanc Mendes (2 September 1946 – 4 May 2020) was a Brazilian songwriter. He co-composed many songs with singer-songwriter João Bosco, guitarist Guinga, and others. He was born in Rio de Janeiro. Elis Regina recorded several of his songs such as "O bêbado e a equilibrista". 

Blanc's work from 1972 to 1987, he was analyzed by Charles A. Perrone in Masters of Contemporary Brazilian Song MPB 1965–1985.

Blanc died of COVID-19 on 4 May 2020 in Rio de Janeiro at the age of 73.

[[Sergei Adian]]

CATEGORIES: 1931 births, 2020 deaths, Russian mathematicians

Sergei Ivanovich Adian, also Adyan (Սերգեյ Իվանովիչ Ադյան; Серге́й Ива́нович Адя́н; 1 January 1931 – 5 May 2020) was a Soviet and Russian mathematician. He was a professor at the Moscow State University. He was known for his work in group theory, especially on the Burnside problem.

Adian died on 5 May 2020, aged 89.

[[Georg Ernst Stahl]]

CATEGORIES: 1659 births, 1734 deaths, German chemists, German philosophers, People from Bavaria

Georg Ernst Stahl (22 October 1659 – 24 May 1734) was a German chemist, physician, and philosopher. He supported vitalism. His works on the phlogiston theory were used to explain chemical processes until the late-18th century.

[[Abraham Yakin]]

CATEGORIES: 1924 births, 2020 deaths, Israeli painters, People from Jerusalem

Abraham Yakin (אברהם יכין;31 July 1924 – 10 May 2020) was an Israeli artist.

Abraham Yakin was born in Jerusalem. He started his artistic training at Bezalel Academy after World War II. Yakin joined the Israel Defense Forces. 

He had his first exhibition in 1953. In 1957 he married Hannah. In 1961, Yakin won the international Adolphe Neumann Prize in Paris. His works are in the Israel Museum, Jerusalem, the Musee d'Art Juif, Paris, and several museums in the Netherlands.

Yakin died on 10 May 2020 in Jerusalem, aged 95.

[[Derek Lawrence]]

CATEGORIES: 1941 births, 2020 deaths, Record producers, Musicians from London, Businesspeople from London

Derek John Lawrence (16 November 1941 – 13 May 2020) was an English record producer. He was famous for his work for Joe Meek's Outlaws, Deep Purple, Flash, Machiavel and Wishbone Ash.

Lawrence died on 13 May 2020 in Peterborough, England at the age of 78.

[[Clive Limpkin]]

CATEGORIES: British photojournalists, 1937 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from brain cancer

Clive Limpkin (1937 – 13 May 2020) was a British photojournalist and writer. He worked as a photojournalist for The Sun in the 1960s and 1970s before joining the Daily Mail. He also worked as a freelance photographer for the Daily Express, The Sunday Times, and The Observer.

Limpkin died at his home in London of brain cancer on 13 May 2020 at the age of 82.

[[Ronald Ludington]]

CATEGORIES: 1934 births, 2020 deaths, American Olympic bronze medalists, Sportspeople from Boston, Massachusetts

Ronald Ludington (September 4, 1934 – May 14, 2020) was an American figure skating coach and pair skater. He worked with his wife Nancy Rouillard Ludington. He was the 1960 Olympic bronze medalist, 1959 World bronze medalist, and a four-time U.S. national champion. He was born in Boston, Massachusetts.

Ludington died on May 14, 2020 in Newark, Delaware at the age of 85.

[[Peggy Etiebet]]

CATEGORIES: 1976 births, Living people, British water polo players, Water polo coaches, British lawyers

Peggy Etiebet (born 19 March 1976) is a British water polo player and coach. She competed for Great Britain in the 2013 World Aquatics Championships.

On a club level, she played for Szentesi VK. She coached for the Senior Women's Water Polo team. 

She is a barrister.

[[Magnetic susceptibility]]

CATEGORIES: Magnetism, Physical quantity

Magnetic susceptibility shows whether a material is attracted into or repelled out of a magnetic field. It is a term in electromagnetism.

It can be measured. Magnetic susceptibility is a prediction of how magnetised a material will get in a  magnetic field. It shows whether a material will be attracted or repelled by a magnet.

[[Hassan Hosny]]

CATEGORIES: 1936 births, Deaths from myocardial infarction, Egyptian movie actors, Egyptian television actors, Comedians, 2020 deaths, People from Cairo

Hassan Hosny (حسن حسنى) (June 19, 1936 – May 30, 2020) was an Egyptian actor and comedian. He was known for his roles in El Nazer ("The headmaster") (2000), El basha telmiz (2004) and Zaky Chan (2005). He was known as the Joker of Egyptian cinema. He was born in Cairo.

Hosny died of a heart attack in Cairo on May 30, 2020 at the age of 88.

[[Lily Lian]]

CATEGORIES: 1917 births, 2020 deaths, French centenarians, French singers

Lily Lian (1 May 1917 – 24 May 2020) was a French singer. She was seen as one of the last street singers of Paris. She worked with Édith Piaf, Tino Rossi, Maurice Chevalier, and Yves Montand. For two years, she was the mistress of actor and music composer Vincent Scotto. Lian made many appearances on his show, titled La Chance aux chansons.

Lian died on 24 May 2020 in Ivry-sur-Seine, France at the age of 103.

[[Osia Lewis]]

CATEGORIES: 1962 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from liver cancer, American football fullbacks, American football linebackers, Sportspeople from Alaska, People from Anchorage, Alaska

Osia Lewis (December 3, 1962 – May 31, 2020) was an American professional arena football player. He played four seasons in the Arena Football League with the Chicago Bruisers and Albany Firebirds. He played college football at Oregon State University. He was born in Anchorage, Alaska.

Lewis died May 31, 2020 from liver cancer in Nashville, Tennessee, aged 57.

[[Claire Nixon]]

CATEGORIES: 1993 births, Living people, British water polo players, Sportspeople from Staffordshire

Claire Nixon (born 14 November 1993) is a British water polo player. She competed for Great Britain in the 2013 World Aquatics Championships.

She was born in Stafford, Staffordshire. She was educated at Great Wyrley High School. She played for the University of Hawaii's women's water polo team.

[[Aine Hoy]]

CATEGORIES: 1987 births, British water polo players, Living people

Aine Hoy (born 16 October 1987) is a British water polo player. She competed for Great Britain in the 2013 World Aquatics Championships.

At the club level, she played for Olympic Nice Natation.

[[Barun, India]]

CATEGORIES: Settlements in Bihar

Barun is a small town in Bihar in the District Aurangabad.

Barun is located 133.7 km (83.1 mi) from Patna Junction station and 11.6 km (7.2 mi) from Aurangabad. The bridge No. 4 for crossing over the Son river is 2.5 km (1.6 mi) away and Dehri-on-sone across river is 5.4 km (3.4 mi) away.

The Pincode of Barun is 824112. Barun is located just 2 km (1.2 mi) away from Grand Trunk Road, which crosses over Sone River to Dehri.

[[Arisney Ramos]]

CATEGORIES: 1989 births, Living people, Cuban water polo players

Arisney Ramos (born 11 May 1989) is a Cuban water polo player. She was a member of the Cuba women's national water polo team at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Sayaun Thunga Phool Ka]]

CATEGORIES: National anthems, Nepal

Sayaũ Thũgā Phūlkā (सयौं थुँगा फूलका), Nepali for "Made of Hundreds of Flowers", has been the national anthem of Nepal since August 2007, replacing "Rāṣṭriya Gān" after a change in regime. The lyrics (words) were written by Byākul Māilā and the music was composed by Amber Gurung.

[[The Virgin Queen (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1955 drama movies, American drama movies, Movies directed by Henry Koster

The Virgin Queen is a 1955 American period drama movie directed by Henry Koster and starring Bette Davis, Rod Taylor, Richard Todd, Joan Collins, Nelson Leigh, Herbert Marshall, Jay Robinson, Dan O'Herlihy. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox and was nominated for an Academy Award in 1956.

[[Unikitty!]]

CATEGORIES: English-language television programs

Unikitty! (stylised as UniKitty!) is an American-Danish-Canadian animated television series produced by The Lego Group and Warner Bros. Animation for Cartoon Network.

1.Spooky Game

[[Someone Like You (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2001 comedy movies, 2001 romance movies, 2000s romantic comedy movies, American romantic comedy movies

Someone Like You is a 2001 American romantic comedy movie directed by Tony Goldwyn and based on the 1998 novel Animal Husbandry by Laura Zigman. It stars Ashley Judd, Ellen Barkin, Greg Kinnear, Hugh Jackman, Marisa Tomei, Laura Regan, Peter Friedman and was distributed by 20th Century Fox.

[[Jebel Irhoud]]

CATEGORIES: Hominins, Archaeological sites in Africa

Jebel Irhoud (or Adrar Ighud,  Berber: Adrar n Iɣud) is an archaeological site. It is just north of Tlet Ighoud, about 50 south-east of Safi in Morocco. 

The site is noted for the hominin fossils that have been found there since its discovery in 1960. Originally thought to be Neanderthals, the specimens have since been assigned to Homo sapiens and have been dated to roughly 300,000 years ago (286 for the Irhoud 3 mandible,  315 based on other fossils and the flint artefacts found nearby). 

[[Hank Mason]]

CATEGORIES: 1931 births, 2020 deaths, African-American baseball players, Philadelphia Phillies players, Sportspeople from Missouri

Henry Mason (June 19, 1931 – May 29, 2020) was an American professional baseball player. He played as a relief pitcher with the 1958 and 1960 Philadelphia Phillies of Major League Baseball. He began his career with the Kansas City Monarchs of the Negro American League. He was a starting pitcher in the 1954 East-West Game. Mason was born in Marshall, Missouri.

Mason died on May 29, 2020 in Richmond, Virginia at the age of 88.

[[Broken Silence]]

CATEGORIES: 1996 drama movies, Swiss movies

Broken Silence is a 1996 Swiss drama movie directed by Wolfgang Panzer and stars Martin Huber, Ameenah Kaplan, Michael Moriaty. It was distributed by Camera Obscura.

[[Marshall, Missouri]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Missouri, County seats in Missouri

Marshall is a city in Saline County, Missouri, United States. The population was 13,065 at the 2010 census. It is the county seat of Saline County.  

[[Akalla]]

CATEGORIES: Settlements in Stockholm County, Districts

Akalla is a district of Sweden, west of Stockholm. About 9,100 people live in Akalla, from many different countries and cultures. The type of houses in Akalla are mostly high rises, and terraced houses. In the centre of Akalla there are restaurants, stores, schools, and pre-schools.

There are four primary schools in Akalla, the most important are Oxhagsskolan and Akalla Grundskola. 

There are three nature reserves around Akalla. 

Akalla is on the blue line of the metro system. 

Most of Akalla voted for the Social democratic party. 

The footballer Robin Quaison and the rapper Dree Low come from Akalla.

[[Jared Fogle]]

CATEGORIES: 1977 births, Living people, Jewish American criminals, American movie actors, People convicted of child pornography offenses, Child sexual abusers, American prisoners, American sex offenders, American television personalities, Actors from Indianapolis, Indiana, Criminals from Indiana

Jared Scott Fogle (born August 23, 1977) is an American former spokesperson for Subway and a convicted sex offender. In the 2000s, he was used to market the promotion of healthy eating with Subway.

Born in Indianapolis, Fogle graduated from North Central High School and Indiana University in 1995 and 2000, respectively. He drew the attention of Subway and the media when an acquaintance wrote an article in the Indiana Daily Student about Fogle losing 245, which he attributed to eating Subway sandwiches. Subway hired Fogle as a spokesperson in 2000, and he was featured in much of the company's advertising from 2000 to 2015; he appeared in Subway commercials, was parodied in an episode of South Park, and had appearances in the Sharknado film series, among others.

Fogle's tenure with Subway ended in 2015 after he was investigated for paying for sex with minors and receiving child pornography; he had been the subject of a long-running investigation by the FBI since 2007. On August 19, 2015, he agreed to plead guilty in federal court to possessing child pornography and traveling to pay for sex with minors. Fogle formally pleaded guilty to the charges on November 19 of that year, and was sentenced to serve 15 years, 8 months in federal prison, with a minimum of 13 years before becoming eligible for early release.

[[You vs. Wild]]

CATEGORIES: 2010s television series debuts, American television series, 2019 television series debuts, Netflix original shows, English-language television programs

You vs. Wild is a 2019 American adventure reality television series on Netflix. The show lets the person watching play a game with Bear Grylls. The game is played by making decisions to help Grylls survive and complete missions in harsh, scary environments. Grylls asks the person watching what to do next, like if he should climb a cliff or move along a coastline. The show came out on April 10, 2019 and has eight episodes.

[[Antonia's Line]]

CATEGORIES: 1995 drama movies, 1995 LGBT movies, Dutch drama movies, Belgian movies, Movies directed by Marleen Gorris

Antonia's Line (Original title: Antonia) is a 1995 Dutch Belgian drama movie directed by Marleen Gorris and starring Willeke van Ammelrooy, Els Dottermans, Jan Decleir, Victor Löw, Johan Heldenbergh, Dora van der Groen. It was distributed by Asmik Ace Entertainment and won an Academy Award in 1996.

[[The Assault (1986 movie)]]

The Assault is a 1986 Dutch World War II drama movie directed by Fons Rademakers and based on the novel of the same name by Harry Mulisch. It stars Derek de Lint, Marc van Uchelen, Monique van de Ven, John Kraaijkamp, Huub van der Lubbe and was distributed by Cannon Films. It won an Academy Award in 1987.

[[Character (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1997 drama movies, Dutch drama movies, Belgian movies, Movies based on books

Character (Karakter) is a 1997 Dutch Belgian period drama movie directed by Mike van Diem and based on the novel of the same name by Ferdinand Bordewijk. It stars Jan Decleir, Fedja van Huêt, Betty Schuurman, Victor Löw, Hans Kesting and won an Academy Award in 1998.

Yol (joɫ is a 1982 Turkish Swiss drama movie directed by Şerif Gören and Yılmaz Güney and stars Tarık Akan, Şerif Sezer, Halil Ergün, Meral Orhonsay.

[[Prime Cut]]

CATEGORIES: 1972 crime movies, 1972 thriller movies, American crime thriller movies, Movies directed by Michael Ritchie

Prime Cut is a 1972 American crime thriller movie directed by Michael Ritchie and starring Lee Marvin, Gene Hackman, Sissy Spacek, Angel Tompkins, Howard Platt, Eddie Egan, Les Lannom. It was distributed by National General Pictures.

[[Aliannis Ramírez]]

Aliannis Ramírez (born 23 September 1997) is a Cuban water polo player. She was a member of the Cuba women's national water polo team at the 2019 Pan American Games and 2019 World Aquatics Championships.

Daniuska Carrasco (born 7 August 1997) is a Cuban water polo player. She was a member of the Cuba women's national water polo team at the 2019 Pan American Games and 2019 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Sodom (band)]]

CATEGORIES: 1980s establishments in Germany, 1981 establishments in Europe, German heavy metal bands, Black metal bands, Speed metal bands, Thrash metal bands, Musical groups established in 1981, Musical quartets, Musicians from North Rhine-Westphalia, People from Gelsenkirchen

Sodom is a thrash metal band from Gelsenkirchen in Germany. The band was formed in 1981.

Thaimí González (born 6 November 1995) is a Cuban water polo player. She was a member of the Cuba women's national water polo team at the 2019 Pan American Games and 2019 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Vampyr]]

Vampyr is a 1932 German Danish French horror movie directed by Carl Theodor Dreyer and based on the 1872 story by Sheridan Le Frau. It stars Nicolas de Gunzburg, Rena Mandel, Sybille Schmitz, Maurice Schutz.

[[Bridge to Nowhere]]

CATEGORIES: 1986 horror movies, 1986 thriller movies, 1980s horror thriller movies, American horror thriller movies, New Zealand movies, Movies directed by Ian Mune

Bridge to Nowhere is a 1986 New Zealand American horror thriller movie directed by Ian Mune and starring Bruno Lawrence, Matthew Hunter, Margaret Umbers, Shelly Luxford, Stephen Judd, Philip Gordon. It was distributed by Mirage Films.

[[Kenting Music Festival]]

CATEGORIES: Rock festivals

Kenting Music Festival, is also known as Kenting Spring Scream Music Festival.  Pingtung county government in Taiwan hosts this event in April every year. Hotels and resorts in Hengchun Peninsula sponsor this event.

The Kenting Music Festival originated as Chun Na , a local musical event,  in 1995. Two Americans: Jimi and Wade, hosted the first Chun Na at Liufu Mountain Villa in Kenting. Taiwan's popular musical bands and singers such as Mayday, Sodagreen, and Zhang Huimei had all participated in Chun Na before they became famous .

[[Sandgrouse]]

CATEGORIES: Birds

The sandgrouse is any one of the sixteen species of a family of ground-dwelling birds known as the Pteroclidae. They usually occur in steppe-like environments, with large open spaces, and few if any trees.  They occur mostly in Africa and Asia.  Some species also live on the Iberian peninsula, and in France. They mostly eat seeds.

[[McFarland & Company]]

CATEGORIES: Publishing companies of the United States, 1979 establishments in the United States, North Carolina

McFarland & Company, Inc. is an independent book publisher in Jefferson, North Carolina. They focus on academic and reference books, as well as general interest nonfiction for adults. Its president is Rhonda Herman. Its former president and current editor-in-chief is Robert Franklin, who created the company in 1979. McFarland has about 50 employees, and  y has published 7,800 books. McFarland's initial print is about 600 copies per book.

[[McLaren Automotive]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 establishments in England, British automobile companies, Surrey

McLaren Automotive is an English sports car company. It is based in Woking, Surrey. It is owned by McLaren Group. It was started as McLaren Automotive on 2 December 1985, and was renamed in 2010 to McLaren Automotive.

[[Arrogate]]

CATEGORIES: 2013 births, 2020 deaths, Thoroughbred racehorses, Deaths by euthanasia

Arrogate (April 11, 2013 – June 2, 2020) was an American Thoroughbred racehorse. He won the 2016 Travers Stakes in a track record in his first stakes appearance. He then won the Breeders' Cup Classic and was named the American Champion Three-Year-Old Male Horse and World's Best Racehorse of 2016. 

He won the 2017 Pegasus World Cup in a new track record followed by a win in the Dubai World Cup. 

Arrogate was euthanized after falling in his stable on June 2, 2020 at the age of 7.

[[Héctor Suárez]]

CATEGORIES: 1938 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from bladder cancer, Mexican movie actors, Mexican television actors, Mexican stage actors, Mexican voice actors, Mexican comedians, Actors from Mexico City

Héctor Suárez Hernández (October 21, 1938 – June 2, 2020) was a Mexican actor and comedian. Suárez was best known for many roles in Mexican comedy. He also starred in Cesar Chavez. He was known for his roles in National Mechanics, El buscabullas and El derecho de nacer.

Suárez died on June 2, 2020 in Mexico City from bladder cancer, aged 81.

[[Carlo Ubbiali]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from respiratory failure, Italian sportspeople

Carlo Ubbiali (22 September 1929 – 2 June 2020) was an Italian nine-time World Champion motorcycle road racer. In the 1950s, he was a known sportsperson in the smaller classes of Grand Prix motorcycle racing. He won six 125cc and three 250cc world titles. He was born in Bergamo, Italy.

Ubbiali died on 2 June 2020 in Bergamo of respiratory failure, aged 90.

[[Wes Unseld]]

CATEGORIES: 1946 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from pneumonia, African-American basketball players, Washington Wizards players, National Basketball Association coaches, Sportspeople from Louisville, Kentucky, American basketball players

Westley Sissel Unseld (March 14, 1946 – June 2, 2020) was an American professional basketball player, coach and executive. He spent his entire National Basketball Association (NBA) career with the Baltimore/Capital/Washington Bullets. He was born in Louisville, Kentucky.

Unseld played college basketball for the Louisville Cardinals and was selected with the second overall pick by the Bullets in the 1968 NBA draft. He was named the NBA Most Valuable Player.

Unseld won an NBA championship with the Bullets in 1978. After retiring from playing in 1981, he worked with the Bullets as a vice president, head coach and general manager.

Unseld was added into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame in 1988 and the National Collegiate Basketball Hall of Fame in 2006.

Unseld died of pneumonia on June 2, 2020 at the age of 74.

[[List of current members of the United States House of Representatives]]

There are 435 voting members of the United States House of Representatives. The state of California has the most, with 53. 

The Democrats are the party with the most representatives.

		display: none !important;

	#mf-know td:last-child tr {

		display: flex;

		flex-direction: column-reverse;

	}

	#mf-know {

		text-align: center;

	}

	#mf-know table {

		margin: 0;

	}

	#mf-know td {

		padding: 0 !important;

	}

	#mf-know td tr {

		padding: 1em 0;

	}

}

[[Lorene Derenty]]

CATEGORIES: 1996 births, Living people, French water polo players

Lorene Derenty (born 4 September 1994) is a French water polo player.

She was a member of the France women's national water polo team at the 2013 Summer Universiade, 2015 World Aquatics Championships, and 2017 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Marion Tardy]]

CATEGORIES: 1993 births, Living people, French water polo players

Marion Tardy (born 12 July 1993 in Saint-Jean-d'Angély) is a French water polo player. She was a member of the France women's national water polo team. She participated at the 2015 World Aquatics Championships. 

On the club level, she played for Lille Métropole Water-Polo. 

[[Lucie Cesca]]

CATEGORIES: 1994 births, Living people, French water polo players

Lucie Cesca (born 26 November 1994) is a French water polo player. She was a member of the France women's national water polo team at the 2015 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Sonia Bouloukbachi]]

CATEGORIES: 1996 births, Living people, French water polo players

Sonia Bouloukbachi (born 10 January 1996) is a French water polo player. She was a member of the France women's national water polo team at the 2015 World Aquatics Championships.

[[Kuaizero]]

Kuaizero is a nick name of Mr. Gao. Godspeed, a transliteration from Lao Gao (1981). He was born in Dalian, Liaoning Province, China, and now living in Japan as a Youtuber. In early May 2018, Godspeed began managing the channel "Mr & Mrs Gao". One year later, on May 18, 2019, the channel opened the membership function. After two days (May 20), it got the achievement of "the fastest growth of YouTube channel members in the world". 

Godspeed graduated from Dalian University of Technology majoring in mechanical automation. In 2004, he hired by a Japanese company to Japan. He engaged in the research. He also engaged development of trading robots in the foreign exchange system. Now he is engaging in IT consulting in the financial industry and part-time Youtuber.

[[Willie Francis]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 1947 deaths, American criminals

Willie Francis (January 12, 1929 – May 9, 1947) is best known for surviving a failed execution by electrocution in the United States.  He was a juvenile offender sentenced to death at age 16 by the state of Louisiana in 1945. He was found guilty for the murder of Andrew Thomas, a Cajun pharmacy owner in St. Martinville who had once employed Francis. Francis was 17 when he survived the first attempt to execute him because the chair did not work correctly. He tried to appeal his case to the US Supreme Court, but the Supreme Court rejected it. He was executed in 1947 at age 18.

[[Lockheed Martin Transit Center]]

CATEGORIES: Rapid transit systems in the United States, Santa Clara County, California

Lockheed Martin Transit Center is a light rail and transit bus station ran by Santa Clara Valley Transportation Authority (VTA), located in Sunnyvale, California. This station is served by the Orange Line of the VTA Light Rail system.

The land for the transit center was donated by Lockheed Martin during the planning of VTA's Tasman West light rail extension.

[[National Mechanics]]

National Mechanics (Spanish:Mecánica nacional) is a 1972 Mexican comedy drama movie directed by Luis Alcoriza and starring Manolo Fábregas, Lucha Villa, Héctor Suárez, Sara García, Alma Muriel, Pancho Córdova, Aurora Clavel, Alejandro Ciangherotti.

[[El buscabullas]]

CATEGORIES: 1976 drama movies, 1970s western movies, Mexican movies

[[Lovefool]]

CATEGORIES: 1996 songs

"Lovefool" is a song written by Peter Svensson and Nina Persson for Swedish rock band The Cardigans' third studio album, First Band on the Moon (1996). It was released as the album's lead single on 14 September 1996 in the United Kingdom and internationally on 5 October 1996.

[[Jacques Noyer]]

CATEGORIES: 1927 births, 2020 deaths, French Roman Catholics, Bishops

Jacques Moïse Eugène Noyer (17 April 1927 – 2 June 2020) was a French Roman Catholic prelate. He was Bishop of Amiens from 31 October 1987 to 10 March 2003. He was born in Le Touquet, France.

He was a Knight of the Legion of Honour in 1993.

Noyer died on 2 June 2020 in Le Touquet at the age of 93.

[[Jacques Gaillot]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, Living people, Activists, French Roman Catholics, Bishops

Jacques Jean Edmond Georges Gaillot (born 11 September 1935); Fr-Jacques Gaillot.ogg; generally known in French as Monseigneur Gaillot) is a French Catholic clergyman and social activist. He was Bishop of Évreux in France from 1982 to 1995. In 1995, Pope John Paul II removed him as head of his diocese.

He is known as the The Red Cleric. He was born in Saint-Dizier, Champagne.

[[Lucha Villa]]

CATEGORIES: 1936 births, Living people, Mexican movie actors, Mexican singers, Mexican television actors, Mexican voice actors

Luz Elena Ruiz Bejarano (born November 30, 1936), more commonly known by her stage name Lucha Villa, is a Mexican singer and actress. She was born in Camargo, Chihuahua. Her music genre was Regional Mexican. Her best known role was as Isabel in the 1972 movie National Mechanics.

[[The Vengeance of She]]

The Vengeance of She is a 1968 British fantasy adventure movie directed by Cliff Owen and starring John Richardson, Olga Schoberová, Edward Judd, André Morrell, Colin Blakley. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox and is a loose sequel to the 1965 movie She.

[[Nelumbo indica]]

CATEGORIES: Plants of Pakistan

Nelumbo Indica, or Nelumbo speciosa, (Urdu:کنول/Sindhi:مقدس ٿورا گل/Punjabi:کنول) also known as Indus Valley lotus, Sindhu lotus, Sindhi lotus, Bean of Pakistan, Pakistani bean or simply Asiatic white lotus, is one of two extant Asian species of aquatic plant in the family Nelumbonaceae. Is a blossom indigenous in the Indus delta of the lower Indus ecoregion, Arabian Sea, Pakistan. It has a very wide native distribution, ranging from eastern, central and northern Pakistan (at altitudes up to 1400 in the Western Himalayas through southern plains of the Punjab and Sindh, it is also the "Provincial flower of Sindh" respectively.

[[Abdollah Javadi Amoli]]

CATEGORIES: 1933 births, Living people

Abdollah Javadi Amoli (عبدالله جوادی آملی) is an Iranian Twelver Shi'a Marja. He is a conservative Iranian politician, philosopher and one of the prominent Islamic scholars of the Hawza in Qom. The official website for his scientific foundation, Isra, describes him as a well-known, outstanding thinker in various fields of Islamic sciences and a distinguished figure in exegesis, jurisprudence, philosophy and mysticism. It is further states that his ideas and views have been reinforcing the Islamic Republic of Iran since the 1979 Islamic Revolution, and that "his strategic and enlightening guidance" has been "extremely constructive" during the past three decades.

[[Nouveau riche]]

CATEGORIES: Pejoratives, Social groups

The word nouveau riche (French for "new rich" or "new wealthy") in English is used in a pejorative manner to describe people who managed to accumulate a large sum of money and wealth within their own generation (such as by winning in lottery or through prosperous businesses, for example), unlike the vieux riche ("old money", "old rich"), whose net worth was acquired through inheritance and come from generations, and are often perceived to lack the refinement and etiquette traditionally attributed to the old rich by the latter.

Sociologically speaking, "nouveau riche" refers to a person who formerly had belonged to a lower social class and economic stratum within that class; and that the new money, which constitutes his/her wealth, granted them upward social mobility and provided the means for conspicuous consumption, the buying of goods and services that signal membership in the upper class.

[[42nd parallel north]]

CATEGORIES: Lines of latitude

The 42nd parallel north is a circle of latitude that is 42 degrees north of the Earth's equatorial plane. It crosses Europe, the Mediterranean Sea, Asia, the Pacific Ocean, North America, and the Atlantic Ocean.

At this latitude the sun is visible for 15 hours, 15 minutes during the summer solstice and 9 hours, 7 minutes during the winter solstice.

[[Spencer Dryden]]

CATEGORIES: 1938 births, 2005 deaths, American rock drummers, Cancer deaths in California, Deaths from colorectal cancer

Spencer Charles Dryden (April 7, 1938 – January 11, 2005) was an American musician. He is best known as a drummer for Jefferson Airplane and New Riders of the Purple Sage. He also played with the Dinosaurs and the Ashes (later known as the Peanut Butter Conspiracy). He was added into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1996.

Dryden was born in New York City. His father was actor and director Wheeler Dryden. He was also a nephew of British actor Charlie Chaplin. He was married three times and had three sons.

On January 11, 2005, Dryden died from metastasized colon cancer in Petaluma, California. He was 66.

[[Wide Blue Yonder (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2012 comedy movies, 2010s black comedy movies, British comedy movies, Norwegian movies

Wide Blue Yonder (Wide Blue Yonder - Begravelse til besvær) is a 2010 Norwegian British black comedy movie directed by Robert Young and based on the play by Hugh Janes. It stars Brian Cox, Lauren Bacall, James Fox, Hege Schøyen, Ingrid Bolsø Berdal and it was distributed by Europafilm.

[[Hazem Harb]]

CATEGORIES: 1980 births, Palestinian people, Artists, Living people

Hazem Harb is a Palestinian visual artist currently based out of Dubai, UAE. Hazem Harb is better known for his visual works including The Invisible Landscape and Concrete Futures. In 2008, Hazem was nominated for The Young Artist of the Year Award by the A. M. Qattan Foundation.

[[47th parallel north]]

CATEGORIES: Lines of latitude

The 47th parallel north is a circle of latitude that is 47 degrees north of the Earth's equatorial plane. It crosses Europe, Asia, the Pacific Ocean, North America, and the Atlantic Ocean.

At this latitude the sun is visible for 15 hours, 54 minutes during the summer solstice and 8 hours, 31 minutes during the winter solstice.

[[13th meridian east]]

CATEGORIES: Lines of longitude

The meridian 13° east of Greenwich is a line of longitude that extends from the North Pole across the Arctic Ocean, Europe, Africa, the Atlantic Ocean, the Southern Ocean, and Antarctica to the South Pole.

The 13th meridian east forms a great circle with the 167th meridian west.

[[20th meridian east]]

CATEGORIES: Lines of longitude

The meridian 20° east of Greenwich is a line of longitude that extends from the North Pole across the Arctic Ocean, Europe, Africa, the Atlantic and Indian oceans, the Southern Ocean, and Antarctica to the South Pole.

The 20th meridian east forms a great circle with the 160th meridian west.

Part of Namibia's borders with Botswana and South Africa are defined by the meridian. The boundary between the Atlantic Ocean and the Indian Ocean is defined by the meridian. The meridian defines the eastern limit of the New Swabia area in Queen Maud Land, Antarctica.

[[Majek Fashek]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from esophageal cancer, Singer-songwriters, Guitarists, Nigerian writers

Majekodunmi Fasheke, popularly known as Majek Fashek (pronounced as Ma-je-ko-dun-mi Ifa-kii-she-eke) (March 1963 – June 2, 2020) was a Nigerian singer-songwriter and guitarist. He was best known in his home country for the 1988 album Prisoner of Conscience, which included the multiple award-winning single "Send Down the Rain". He worked with Tracy Chapman, Jimmy Cliff, Michael Jackson, Snoop Dogg, and Beyoncé.

[[Nicolas Rea, 3rd Baron Rea]]

CATEGORIES: 1928 births, 2020 deaths, British physicians, Politicians from London

John Nicolas Rea, 3rd Baron Rea (6 June 1928 – 1 June 2020), commonly known as Nicolas Rea, was a British hereditary peer, doctor and politician. He was a member of the Labour Party. 

Rea was acting sergeant in the Suffolk Regiment between 1946 and 1948. From 1957 to 1962, and from 1968 to 1993, he also worked as general practitioner in North London.

Rea was a member of Amicus, Healthlink Worldwide and the Mary Ward Centre. He was a fellow of the Royal Society of Medicine. He was a member of the House of Lords after the House of Lords Act 1999.

Rea died on 1 June 2020 at the age of 91.

[[Paolo Fabbri (semiotician)]]

CATEGORIES: Italian writers, Italian educators, 1939 births, 2020 deaths

Paolo Fabbri (17 April 1939 – 2 June 2020) was an Italian semiotician and professor. He was born in Rimini, Kingdom of Italy. 

Fabbri taught at the Italian Cultural Institute in Paris from 1992 to 1996. He also taught at the University of Florence, the University of Urbino, the University of Palermo, the School for Advanced Studies in the Social Sciences, and the Collège international de philosophie. 

Fabbri died on 2 June 2020 in Rimini, aged 81.

[[Mary Pat Gleason]]

CATEGORIES: Emmy Award winners, Writers from Minnesota, Actors from Minnesota, American television writers, American stage actors, American movie actors, American television actors, Deaths from uterine cancer, 1950 births, 2020 deaths

[[Lake City, Minnesota]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Minnesota

Lake City is a city in Goodhue and Wabasha counties in the U.S. state of Minnesota.  It lies along Lake Pepin. The population was 5,063 at the 2010 census.  

[[Jean-Claude Hamel]]

CATEGORIES: 1929 births, 2020 deaths, French businesspeople

Jean-Claude André Adolphe Hamel (9 July 1929 – 2 June 2020) was a French businessman. He was the President of AJ Auxerre from 1963 to 2009. In 2002, he was made Chevalier of the Légion d'honneur. Hamel was born in Auxerre, France.

Hamel died on 2 June 2020 in Appoigny, France, aged 90.

[[Déjà Vu (1985 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 1985 drama movies, 1980s fantasy movies, British drama movies, British fantasy movies

Déjà Vu is a 1985 British fantasy drama movie directed by Anthony B. Richmond and based on the novel Always by Trevor Meldal-Johnsen. It stars Jaclyn Smith, Nigel Terry, Shelley Winters, Claire Bloom and was distributed by Cannon Films.

[[Bruce Jay Friedman]]

CATEGORIES: 1930 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from peripheral neuropathy, American novelists, American playwrights, Screenwriters from New York City

Bruce Jay Friedman (April 26, 1930 – June 3, 2020) was an American novelist, screenwriter and playwright. He was born in New York City. He wrote the screenplay for The Heartbreak Kid (1972), Stir Crazy (1980), Splash and The Lonely Guy (both 1984). His best known play was Steambath (1970).

Friedman died on June 3, 2020 in New York City from problems caused by peripheral neuropathy, aged 90.

[[Jamie Cullum]]

CATEGORIES: 1979 births, Living people, English singer-songwriters, English guitarists, English pianists, English pop singers, English pop musicians, English radio personalities, Jazz singers, Jazz musicians, Musicians from Essex, Singers from Essex, Writers from Essex

Jamie Cullum (born 20 August 1979) is an English jazz-pop singer-songwriter, musician and radio presenter. He has recorded eight studio albums, three compilation albums, one live album and twenty-four singles. He began presenting a weekly Tuesday evening jazz show on BBC Radio 2 in 2010. He was born in Rochford, Essex.

[[Rochford]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Essex

Rochford is a town in the Rochford district of Essex in the East of England. It is about 43 from Central London. Its about 21 from Chelmsford, the county town of Essex. According to the 2001 census, it had a population of 7,610.

[[Johnny Majors]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2020 deaths, American football players, College football coaches, Sportspeople from Tennessee, People from Lynchburg, Tennessee

John Terrill Majors (May 21, 1935sndJune 3, 2020) was an American professional football player and college coach. He was born in Lynchburg, Tennessee.

He began as a halfback at the University of Tennessee. He was a two-time winner of the Southeastern Conference Most Valuable Player award, in 1955 and 1956. 

After playing one season in the Canadian Football League (CFL), Majors became a college assistant coach. He was the head coach at Iowa State University (1968–1972), the University of Pittsburgh (1973–1976, 1993–1996), and Tennessee (1977–1992). 

His 1976 Pittsburgh squad won a national championship. He was added into the College Football Hall of Fame as a player in 1987.

Majors died on June 3, 2020 at his home in Knoxville, Tennessee at the age of 85.

[[Knox County, Tennessee]]

CATEGORIES: Tennessee counties

Knox County is a county in the U.S. state of Tennessee. As of the 2010 census, the population was 432,226. Its county seat is Knoxville. 

[[Lynchburg, Tennessee]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Tennessee

Lynchburg is a city in the south-central region of the U.S. state of Tennessee. Lynchburg is best known as the location of where Jack Daniel's created his famous Tennessee whiskey. The population was 6,362 at the 2010 census.

[[Moore County, Tennessee]]

CATEGORIES: Tennessee counties

Moore County is a county located in the south central part of the U.S. state of Tennessee. As of the 2010 census, the population was 6,362. Its county seat of Lynchburg.

[[New York Coin]]

CATEGORIES: 2014 establishments, Cryptocurrency

New York Coin is a peer-to-peer cryptocurrency and open-source software project released under the MIT/X11 license. Creation and transfer of coins is based on an open source cryptographic protocol and is not managed by any central authority.2021 года в обороте находятся 143 млрд.

[[DeRay Mckesson]]

CATEGORIES: 1985 births, Living people, American civil rights activists, American LGBT rights activists, American radio personalities, LGBT writers, LGBT politicians, Gay men, American autobiographers, Writers from Baltimore, Maryland, Politicians from Baltimore, Maryland

DeRay Mckesson (born July 9, 1985) is an American civil rights activist, podcaster, and former school administrator. He is a founding supporter of the Black Lives Matter movement. He has been active in the protests in Ferguson, Missouri, and Baltimore, Maryland and on social media such as Twitter and Instagram.

Mckesson has also written for HuffPost and The Guardian. 

On February 3, 2016, Mckesson announced his candidacy in the for Mayor of Baltimore He finished with 3,445 votes (2.6%) placing sixth in the Democratic Party primary on April 26.

Mckesson was born in Baltimore, Maryland. He studied at Bowdoin College. He is openly gay.

[[Polysemy]]

CATEGORIES: Grammar

Polysemy is the coexistence of many possible meanings for a word or phrase.

[[Queen Jetsun Pema]]

CATEGORIES: 1990 births, Bhutanese people, Buddhists, Living people

Jetsun Pema (Dzongkha: རྗེ་བཙུན་པདྨ་; Wylie: rje btsun padma; born 4 June 1990) is the Queen (Druk Gyaltsuen, which literally means “Dragon Queen”) of Bhutan, as the wife of King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck.

[[Maria Alice Vergueiro]]

CATEGORIES: 1935 births, 2020 deaths, People from São Paulo, Brazilian movie actors, Brazilian television actors, Brazilian stage actors, Brazilian theatre directors, Deaths from pneumonia

Maria Alice Monteiro de Campos Vergueiro (January 19, 1935 – June 3, 2020) was a Brazilian actress and theatre director. She was born in São Paulo, Brazil. Her best known roles were as Delegado's wife in O Corpo (1991) and as Motorista in Cronicamente Inviável (2000).

Vergueiro died on June 3, 2020 at a hospital in São Paulo from pneumonia, aged 85.

[[Sarah Jeffery]]

CATEGORIES: 1996 births, Living people, Actors from Vancouver, Canadian child actors, Dancers, Canadian movie actors, Canadian television actors, Canadian voice actors, Canadian singers

Sarah Marie Jeffery (born April 3, 1996) is a Canadian actress, singer and dancer. She is known for her work on the NBC series Shades of Blue and Disney Channel's Descendants franchise. She also plays Maggie Vera on the CW series Charmed.

[[Madeleine Mantock]]

CATEGORIES: 1990 births, Actors from Nottinghamshire, People from Nottingham, English movie actors, English television actors, English voice actors, English stage actors, Living people

Madeleine Mantock (born 26 May 1990) is a British actress. She is known for her work on the television series Into the Badlands and a remake of the series The Tomorrow People. She also stars in the lead role of witch Macy Vaughn on The CW series Charmed. She was born in Nottingham, England.

[[Melonie Diaz]]

CATEGORIES: 1984 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American voice actors, Actors from New York City

Melonie Diaz (born April 25, 1984) is an American actress. She is known for her roles in independent movies such as A Guide to Recognizing Your Saints (2006) and Fruitvale Station (2013). She also stars in the lead role of witch Mel Vera on the television series Charmed. She was born in New York City.

[[Questlove]]

CATEGORIES: 1971 births, Living people, American drummers, American guitarists, American hip hop musicians, American soul musicians, American educators, American journalists, Musicians from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, Writers from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Ahmir Khalib Thompson (born January 20, 1971), known professionally as Questlove (stylized as ?uestlove), is an American musician and music journalist. He is the drummer and one of the frontperson for the hip hop band, the Roots. The Roots is the in-house band for The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon since February 17, 2014. 

Questlove is also one of the producers of the cast album of the Broadway musical Hamilton. He is the co-founder of the websites Okayplayer and OkayAfrica. 

He is an instructor at the Clive Davis Institute of Recorded Music at New York University.

[[Phylicia Rashad]]

CATEGORIES: Tony Award winning actors, Drama Desk Award winners, 1948 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American stage actors, American voice actors, American theatre directors, Actors from Houston, Texas, Singers from Houston, Texas

Phylicia Rashād (f fih) (née Ayers-Allen; born June 19, 1948) is an American actress, singer and theatre director. She is known for her role as Clair Huxtable on the NBC sitcom The Cosby Show (1984–92), which earned her Emmy Award nominations in 1985 and 1986. 

In 2004, Rashad became the first black actress to win the Tony Award for Best Actress in a Play for her role in the revival of A Raisin in the Sun.

[[Soul (2020 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2020 comedy movies, 2020s animated movies, Pixar movies, Disney+ movies, American animated movies, American comedy movies, Academy Award winning movies

Soul is an 2020 American computer-animated comedy movie produced by Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar Animation Studios that has been released by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures. It is directed by Pete Docter. It stars Jamie Foxx, Tina Fey, Questlove, Phylicia Rashad, Daveed Diggs, and Angela Bassett.

Soul was released on December 25, 2020 on Disney+. It won the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature in 2021.

[[Scoob!]]

CATEGORIES: 2020 movies, American animated movies, American mystery movies, American comedy movies, Warner Bros. movies, Scooby-Doo movies, 2020s comedy movies

Scoob! is a 2020 American computer-animated comedy mystery movie produced by Warner Animation Group and based on the Scooby-Doo franchise. 

The movie is directed by Tony Cervone. It stars the voices of Frank Welker, Will Forte, Gina Rodriguez, Zac Efron, and Amanda Seyfried as the Mystery Gang with Mark Wahlberg, Jason Isaacs, Kiersey Clemons, Ken Jeong and Tracy Morgan as other Hanna-Barbera animated characters. 

The movie is about the Mystery Gang and Blue Falcon trying to stop Dick Dastardly from opening the Underworld and releasing Cerberus.

Scoob! was released digitally via video on demand on May 15, 2020. It was initially set to play in theaters, but the theatrical release was canceled in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Despite receiving mixed reviews from film critics it was positively welcomed from audiences and fans alike.

[[Walnut Bread]]

CATEGORIES: 1978 drama movies, Lithuanian movies

Walnut Bread (Riešutų duona) is a 1978 Lithuanian drama movie directed by Arūnas Žebriūnas and starring Algirdas Latėnas, Saulius Sipaitis, Doloresa Kazragytė, Leonid Obolensky, Antanas Šurna.

[[Kiersey Clemons]]

CATEGORIES: 1993 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American voice actors, LGBT actors, LGBT singers, Actors from Florida, Singers from Florida, People from Pensacola, Florida

Kiersey Nicole Clemons (born December 17, 1993) is an American actress and singer.

She is known for her roles in Neighbors 2: Sorority Rising, Flatliners, Hearts Beat Loud, and the 2019 remake of Lady and the Tramp. She voiced the role of Dee Dee Skyes in the animated movie Scoob!.

Clemons was cast as Iris West in the Justice League, but her scenes were cut and later restored in the 2021 director's cut. She will play the role again in the 2022 movie The Flash.

[[Respect (2021 movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2021 movies, 2020s drama movies, American drama movies, Upcoming movies

Respect is an upcoming 2020 American biographical drama movie directed by Liesl Tommy. It will be based on the life of singer Aretha Franklin. It stars Jennifer Hudson in the leading role. Forest Whitaker, Marlon Wayans, Audra McDonald, Queen Latifah, Marc Maron, Tituss Burgess, Tate Donovan, and Mary J. Blige also star.

The movie is scheduled to be released in the United States on August 13, 2021.

[[The Disaster Artist (movie)]]

CATEGORIES: 2010s biographical movies, 2017 comedy movies, American biographical movies, American comedy movies, Movies based on books

The Disaster Artist is a 2017 American biographical comedy movie. It was directed by James Franco. The movie is based from Greg Sestero and Tom Bissell's 2013 non-fiction book of the same title. 

The movie is about an unlikely friendship between unknown actors Tommy Wiseau and Sestero that soon make the 2003 movie The Room. 

The Disaster Artist stars brothers James and Dave Franco as Wiseau and Sestero alongside Alison Brie, Ari Graynor, Josh Hutcherson, Jacki Weaver, and co-producer Seth Rogen.

It was released on December 1, 2017 to strong positive reviews.

[[Respect (song)]]

CATEGORIES: 1965 songs, 1967 songs

"Respect" is a song written and originally released by American recording artist Otis Redding in 1965. The song became a 1967 hit and signature song for soul singer Aretha Franklin. In Franklin's version, the song is about a woman who wants her husband's respect. 

Franklin's version adds the "R-E-S-P-E-C-T" chorus and the backup singers'.

[[Christina Schollin]]

CATEGORIES: 1937 births, Living people, Swedish movie actors, Swedish television actors, Swedish stage actors, Swedish voice actors, Actors from Stockholm

Christina Schollin (born Christina Alma Elisabet Schollin; 26 December 1937) is a Swedish actress. She is best known for her roles in Dear John, Song of Norway and Ingmar Bergman's Fanny and Alexander.

[[Hans Wahlgren]]

CATEGORIES: Living people, 1937 births, Swedish movie actors, Swedish television actors, Swedish stage actors, Swedish voice actors, People from Gothenburg

Hans Carl Gustav Wahlgren (born 26 June 1937) is a Swedish actor. He stars in the Swedish reality show Wahlgrens värld which is broadcast on Kanal 5. He voiced Charles Ingvar "Sickan" Jönssons in the computer games Jönssonligan: Jakten på Mjölner and Jönssonligan går på djupet.

Wahlgren was born in Helsingborg, Sweden. He was raised in Gothenburg. In 1962, he married actress Christina Schollin. They have four children; including singer Pernilla.

[[The Fairfax Millions]]

CATEGORIES: 1980 drama movies, 1980s crime drama movies, Russian movies

The Fairfax Millions (Milliony Ferfaksa) is a 1980 Russian crime drama movie directed by Nikolai Ilinsky and based on the novel of the same name by Alan Winnington. It stars Juozas Budraitis, Juris Strenga, Gediminas Girdvanis, Galina Jovovich, Ivars Kalniņš, Yevgeny Vesnik, Helga Dantzberg and was distributed by Dovzhenko Film Studios.

[[Cohutta, Georgia]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Georgia (U.S. state)

Cohutta k is a town in Whitfield County, Georgia, United States. It is part of the Dalton Metropolitan Statistical Area. The population was 661 at the 2010 census.

[[Whitfield County, Georgia]]

CATEGORIES: 1850s establishments in Georgia (U.S. state), 1851 establishments in the United States

Whitfield County is a county located in the northwestern part of the U.S. state of Georgia. As of the 2010 census shows a population of 102,599. The county seat is Dalton. The county was created on December 30, 1851. 

[[Cyclone Nisarga]]

CATEGORIES: June 2020 events

Severe Cyclonic Storm Nisarga is a currently active tropical cyclone going towards the coastline of the Indian state of Maharashtra. 

Nisarga was expected to hit the western coastline of India. On 2 June 2020, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) revisited Nisarga as severe cyclonic storm from cyclonic storm. It had its landfall in the coastal town of Alibag in Maharashtra on 3 June 2020.

It is the first super cyclonic storm to happen in the Bay of Bengal in the 21st century. Nisarga is the first severe cyclonic storm since 1891 to impact Mumbai.

[[Hannibal Buress]]

CATEGORIES: 1983 births, Living people, American movie actors, American television actors, American voice actors, American television writers, American television producers, Actors from Chicago, Comedians from Chicago, Screenwriters from Chicago, Movie producers from Chicago

Hannibal Amir Buress (ˈ, born February 4, 1983) is an American comedian, actor, writer, and producer. He has co-starred on Adult Swim's The Eric Andre Show since 2012. He also starred on Comedy Central's Broad City from 2014 to 2019. He was born in Chicago.

[[Brutus Beefcake]]

CATEGORIES: 1957 births, Living people, WWE wrestlers, Sportspeople from Tampa, Florida

Edward Harrison Leslie (born April 21, 1957) is an American retired professional wrestler. He is best known for his work in the World Wrestling Federation (WWF) under the ring name Brutus "The Barber" Beefcake. 

He later worked for World Championship Wrestling (WCW). He was born in Tampa, Florida.

He was honored in the WWE Hall of Fame in 2019.

[[Orange Park, Florida]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Florida

Orange Park is a town in Clay County, Florida, United States, and a suburb of Jacksonville. The population was 8,412 at the 2010 census. 

[[Bridget Jones's Diary]]

CATEGORIES: 2001 comedy movies, 2001 romance movies, 2000s romantic comedy movies, American romantic comedy movies, British romantic comedy movies, French romance movies

Bridget Jones's Diary is a 2001 British American French romantic comedy movie directed by Sharon Maguire and based on the 1996 novel of the same name by Helen Fielding. It stars Renée Zellweger in her Oscar nominated role, Hugh Grant, Colin Firth, Jim Broadbent, Celia Imrie, James Faulkner, Shirley Henderson, James Callis, Ben Peyton, Donald Douglas, Embeth Davidtz, Felicity Montagu, Neil Pearson and was distributed by Miramax Films.

Alexander Mark David Oxlade-Chamberlain ˌ (born 15 August 1993) is an English professional footballer. He plays as a midfielder for Liverpoo club Liverpool and the England national team.

[[Virgins of Riga]]

Virgins of Riga is a 1996 Norwegian Latvian Swedish comedy movie directed by Emil Stang Lund and starring Aurelija Anuzhite, Uldis Dumpis, Jon Eikemo, Helge Jordal, Viggo Jønsberg, Ivars Kalnins, Nils Vogt.

[[Shinae Carrington]]

CATEGORIES: 2000 births, Living people, New Zealand water polo players

Shinae Carrington (born 18 October 2000) is a New Zealand water polo player. She competed for the New Zealand women's national water polo team in the 2018 FINA Youth Water Polo World Championships, 2019 World Aquatics Championships, and 2019 FINA World League.

She was educated at Diocesan School for Girls, Auckland. She plays for Marist University.

[[Simone van de Kraats]]

CATEGORIES: 2000 births, Living people, Dutch water polo players

Simone van de Kraats (born November 15, 2000) is a Dutch water polo player. She plays for the Netherlands women's national water polo team. She participated at the 2019 World Water Polo Championship.

[[Maartje Keuning]]

CATEGORIES: 1998 births, Living people, Dutch water polo players

Maartje Keuning (born 26 April 1998) is a Dutch water polo player. She plays for the Netherlands women's national water polo team. She participated at the 2019 World Aquatics Championships.

She is a native of Stompetoren. She was educated at OSG Willem Blaeu. She played for University of Hawaii's women's water polo team. and CN Sant Andreu.

[[Axelle Crevier]]

CATEGORIES: 1997 births, Living people, Canadian water polo players, Sportspeople from Montreal

Axelle Crevier (born 22 March 1997 in Montreal) is a female water polo player from Canada. She was a member of the Canada women's national water polo team at the 2017 World Aquatics Championships and 2019 Pan American Games.

[[Kyra Christmas]]

CATEGORIES: 1997 births, Living people, Canadian water polo players

Kyra Christmas (born 14 March 1997) is a female water polo player from Canada. She was a member of the Canada women's national water polo team at the 2017 World Aquatics Championships and 2019 Pan American Games.

She played for the University of the Pacific's women's water polo team.

[[Rose Leslie]]

CATEGORIES: 1987 births, Living people, People from Aberdeen, Scottish stage actors, Scottish television actors, Scottish movie actors, Scottish voice actors

Rose Eleanor Arbuthnot-Leslie (born 9 February 1987) is a Scottish actress. She is known for her roles as Gwen Dawson in the ITV drama series Downton Abbey and as Ygritte in the HBO fantasy series Game of Thrones. 

[[Downton Abbey]]

CATEGORIES: 2010 television series debuts, 2015 television series endings, English-language television programs

Downton Abbey is a British historical drama television series set in the early 20th century. It was created and co-written by Julian Fellowes.  The series first aired on ITV in the United Kingdom on 26 September 2010, and in the United States on PBS on 9 January 2011.

On 26 March 2015, Carnival Films and ITV announced that the sixth series would be the last. It aired on ITV between 20 September 2015 and 8 November 2015. The final episode, serving as the annual Christmas special, was broadcast on 25 December 2015.

A movie version was released in the United Kingdom on 13 September 2019, and in the United States on 20 September 2019.

[[Castle Rock, Colorado]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Colorado, County seats in Colorado

Castle Rock is a home rule municipality that is the county seat of Douglas County, Colorado, United States. It had a population of 48,231 at the 2010 United States Census. It is named for the castle-tower-shaped butte near the center of town. 

[[Castle Rock (Colorado)]]

CATEGORIES: Mountains of the United States, Geography of Colorado

Castle Rock is a butte in the Colorado Piedmont region of the Great Plains. The town of Castle Rock, Colorado is named after the butte.

[[Elyse Lemay-Lavoie]]

CATEGORIES: 1994 births, Living people, Canadian water polo players

Elyse Lemay-Lavoie (born 12 November 1994) is a Canadian water polo player. She is a member of the Canadian women's national water polo team. She participated at the 2017 FINA World League, 2017 World Aquatics Championships, 2018 FINA World League, 2019 FINA World League, and 2019 Pan-American Games.

She played for the Université de Montréal's women's water polo team and University of Hawaii's women's water polo team.

[[The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension]]

CATEGORIES: 1984 comedy movies, 1984 romance movies, 1980s science fiction movies, 1980s romantic comedy movies, American science fiction movies, American romantic comedy movies, Cult movies, American superhero movies

The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension is a 1984 American science fiction romantic comedy movie directed by W. D. Richter and starring Tom Hanks, Ellen Barkin, John Lithgow, Jeff Goldblum, Christopher Lloyd, Vincent Schiavelli, Rosalind Cash, Clancy Brown, Robert Ito, Ronald Lacey, Billy Vera and Laura Harrington. It was distributed by 20th Century Fox and became a cult classic.

Hayley McKelvey (born 11 March 1996) is a water polo player from Canada. She was a member of the Canada women's national water polo team at the 2017 World Aquatics Championships and 2019 Pan American Games.

She played for University of Southern California's women's water polo team.

Letícia Belorio (born 22 January 2001) is a Brazilian water polo player.

[[Jeff Kinney]]

CATEGORIES: American children's writers, American cartoonists, 1971 births, Living people, Writers from Massachusetts, Writers from Maryland

Jeffrey Patrick Kinney (born February 19, 1971) is an American author and cartoonist. He is best known for the children's book series Diary of a Wimpy Kid. He also created the child-oriented website Poptropica.

[[Fort Washington, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Census-designated places in Maryland, Unincorporated communities in Maryland

Fort Washington is an unincorporated area and census-designated place in Prince George's County, Maryland, United States. It borders the capital of the United States, Washington, D.C.. As of the 2010 census it had a population of 23,717. 

[[Upper Marlboro, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: County seats in Maryland, Towns in Maryland

Upper Marlboro, officially the Town of Upper Marlboro, is the seat of Prince George's County, Maryland, United States. The population within the town limits was 631 at the 2010 U.S. Census. 

[[Greater Upper Marlboro, Maryland]]

CATEGORIES: Unincorporated communities in Maryland

Greater Upper Marlboro is an area of Prince George's County, Maryland, United States. It completely surrounds Upper Marlboro, the county seat. It was formerly a census-designated place (CDP), with a population of 18,720 at the 2000 census. 

Greater Upper Marlboro is located at 38.827569.

[[Plainville, Massachusetts]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Massachusetts

Plainville is a town in Norfolk County, Massachusetts, United States. The population at the 2010 census was 8,264. Plainville is part of the Boston and Providence metropolitan areas.

[[Muscogee County, Georgia]]

CATEGORIES: 1826 establishments in Georgia (U.S. state)

Muscogee County is a county located in the U.S. state of Georgia. Its western border with the state of Alabama is formed by the Chattahoochee River. As of the 2010 census, the population was 189,885. Its county seat and only city is Columbus.

[[Dangerous Summer]]

CATEGORIES: 2000s war movies, 2000 drama movies, Latvian movies, World War II movies

Dangerous Summer (Baiga vasara) is a 2000 Latvian World War II drama movie directed by Aigars Grauba and starring Inese Cauna, Uldis Dumpis, Eduards Pāvuls, Jānis Reinis, Artūrs Skrastiņš.

[[Chattahoochee River]]

CATEGORIES: Rivers of Georgia (U.S. state), Rivers of Alabama, Rivers of Florida

The Chattahoochee River forms the southern half of the Alabama and Georgia border. It is a tributary of the Apalachicola River. The Chattahoochee River is about 430 long. 

The Chattahoochee, Flint, and Apalachicola rivers together make up the Apalachicola–Chattahoochee–Flint River Basin (ACF River Basin).

[[Apalachicola River]]

CATEGORIES: Rivers of Florida, Rivers of Georgia (U.S. state)

The Apalachicola River æ is a river, about 112 mi (180 km) long in the state of Florida. The river's large watershed, known as the ACF River Basin, drains an area of about 19500 into the Gulf of Mexico. 

The distance to its farthest head waters in northeast Georgia is about 500 miles (800 km). Its name comes from the Apalachicola people, who used to live along the river.

[[Peachtree Corners, Georgia]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Georgia (U.S. state), Gwinnett County, Georgia

Peachtree Corners is a city that is a suburb of Atlanta northeast of that city and located in western Gwinnett County, Georgia. It is the largest city in Gwinnett County with a population of 43,509 in 2018. The city is bordered to the north and west by the Chattahoochee River and is located east of Dunwoody. 

[[Dunwoody, Georgia]]

CATEGORIES: Cities in Georgia (U.S. state)

Dunwoody is a city in DeKalb County, Georgia, United States. It is a northern suburb of Atlanta. As of 2019, the city has a population of 49,356.

[[O'Hara Township, Allegheny County, Pennsylvania]]

CATEGORIES: Townships in Pennsylvania

O'Hara Township is a township with home rule status in Allegheny County, Pennsylvania in the United States. It is six miles northeast of Downtown Pittsburgh. The population was 8,407 at the 2010 census.

[[Wendy Makkena]]

CATEGORIES: 1963 births, Living people, Actors from New York City, American movie actors, American stage actors, American television actors

Wendy Rosenberg Makkena m (born October 4, 1958) is an American actress. She has appeared in  Sister Act (1992) and its sequel Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit (1993), Air Bud (1997), State of Play (2009), and A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood (2019).

[[Sister Act]]

CATEGORIES: 1992 movies, American musical comedy movies

Sister Act is a 1992 American musical comedy movie directed by Emile Ardolino and written by Joseph Howard. It stars Whoopi Goldberg as a singer forced to join a convent after being placed in a witness protection program. It also stars Maggie Smith, Kathy Najimy, Wendy Makkena, Mary Wickes, and Harvey Keitel.

A sequel was released in 1993 titled Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit. A remake of Sister Act is in the works.

[[Emile Ardolino]]

CATEGORIES: 1943 births, 1993 deaths, Deaths from AIDS, American choreographers, LGBT directors, LGBT producers, Gay men, Movie directors from New York City, Movie producers from New York City, LGBT people from New York City

Emile Ardolino (May 9, 1943 – November 20, 1993) was an American movie director, choreographer, and producer. He was best known for directing Dirty Dancing (1987) and Sister Act (1992). He was born in New York City.

Ardolino died of AIDS in Los Angeles on November 20, 1993 at the age of 50.

[[Madison, Connecticut]]

CATEGORIES: Towns in Connecticut

Madison is a town in the southeastern corner of New Haven County, Connecticut, United States. The population was 18,269 at the 2010 census.

[[Marc de Hond]]

CATEGORIES: 1977 births, 2020 deaths, Deaths from bladder cancer, Deaths from spinal cancer, DJs, Dutch businesspeople, Dutch Jews, Dutch radio personalities, Dutch stage actors, Dutch television presenters, Dutch wheelchair basketball players, Jewish actors, Jewish businesspeople, Jewish sportspeople, Jewish writers, Paralympians, Sportspeople from Amsterdam, Writers from Amsterdam

Marc David de Hond (21 September 1977 – 3 June 2020) was a Dutch television presenter, businessman, writer, theatre performer and basketball player. He played for the Dutch wheelchair basketball team during the Paralympic Games. He was also a discjockey for radio 3FM and Caz!.

He presented on television programs such as Expedition Unlimited  for LLiNK, De Rekenkamer for KRO at Nederland 3 and was the regular commentator for poker competitions at  RTL 7. 

In 2002, de Hond became paralyzed because of a spinal cord caused by spinal cancer. In 2018, he was diagnosed with bladder cancer. de Hond died from the diseases on 3 June 2020 in Amsterdam, aged 42.

Marc de Hond was born in Amsterdam. He is of Jewish origin and son of television personality Maurice de Hond.

[[Magnavox]]

CATEGORIES: 1917 establishments in the United States, Companies of the United States, Electronics companies, Video game companies

Magnavox (Latin for "great voice", stylized as MAGNAVOX or sometimes Magnavox) is an American electronics company. It was founded in 1917 by Edwin Pridham and Peter L. Jensen in the United States. In 1974, it became a subsidiary of Philips, a Dutch electronics corporation.

It is known for releasing the Magnavox Odyssey in 1972, the first commercial video game console.

[[Lima bean]]

CATEGORIES: Beans

The lima bean (ˈ) (Phaseolus lunatus), also known as the butter bean, sieva bean, double Bean or Madagascar bean, is a legume grown for its edible seeds or beans.

[[Dzongkha]]

CATEGORIES: Bhutan, Languages of Asia, Sino-Tibetan languages

Dzongkha or Bhutanese (རྫོང་ཁ་, dzoŋkʰa), is the national language of Bhutan.
